definition[1]: a period of time between two dates or events
example[0]: It’ll be difficult to hire that many new staff in such a short time span.
example[1]: Over a span of ten years, the company has made great progress.
definition[2]: the length of time over which someone’s life, ability to pay attention to something etc continues
example[2]: Captivity vastly reduces the life span of whales.
example[3]: Most two-year-olds have a very short attention span.
definition[3]: the part of a bridge, arch etc that goes across from one support to another
definition[4]: the distance from one side of something to the other
example[4]: a bird with a large wing span
definition[5]: to include all of a period of time
example[5]: a career which spanned nearly 60 years
definition[6]: to include all of a particular space or area
example[6]: The Mongol Empire spanned much of Central Asia.
definition[7]: if a bridge spans an area of water, especially a river, it goes from one side to the other
